# `dunlin`: Tools for Clinical Trial Data Wrangling

[![Open
Issues](https://img.shields.io/github/issues-raw/insightsengineering/dunlin?color=red&label=open%20issues)](https://github.com/insightsengineering/dunlin/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+sort%3Aupdated-desc)

`dunlin` provides a variety of data tools to reformat and manipulate a
subset of the tables in a data set.

## Installation

``` r
# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("insightsengineering/dunlin@*release")
```

Alternatively, you might also use the development version.

``` r
# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("insightsengineering/dunlin")
```

## Usage

``` r
library(dunlin)

df1 <- data.frame(
  "id" = c("a", "b", NA, "a", "k", "x"),
  "id2" = factor(c("f1", "f2", NA, NA, "f1", "f1")),
  "val" = letters[1:6]
)
df2 <- data.frame(
  "id" = c("a", "b", NA, "a", "k", "x"),
  "id2" = factor(c("f1", "f2", NA, NA, "f1", "f1")),
  "num" = 1:6
)

db <- list(df1 = df1, df2 = df2)

prop_db <- propagate(db, "df1", "val", c("id", "id2"))
```

which returns `prop_db` as

``` text
 $df1
    id  id2 val
1    a   f1   a
2    b   f2   b
3 <NA> <NA>   c
4    a <NA>   d
5    k   f1   e
6    x   f1   f

$df2
    id  id2 num val
1    a   f1   1   a
2    b   f2   2   b
3 <NA> <NA>   3   c
4    a <NA>   4   d
5    k   f1   5   e
6    x   f1   6   f
```

``` r
new_format <- list(
  df1 = list(
    id = rule("No ID available" = c("", NA, "<Missing>")),
    id2 = rule("<Missing>" = c("", NA, "<Missing>"))
  )
)

res <- reformat(prop_db, new_format, .na_last = TRUE)
```

which result in `res` as

``` text
$df1
               id       id2 val
1               a        f1   a
2               b        f2   b
3 No ID available <Missing>   c
4               a <Missing>   d
5               k        f1   e
6               x        f1   f

$df2
    id  id2 num val
1    a   f1   1   a
2    b   f2   2   b
3 <NA> <NA>   3   c
4    a <NA>   4   d
5    k   f1   5   e
6    x   f1   6   f
```

# Package index

## Packages

- [`dunlin`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/dunlin-package.md)
  [`dunlin-package`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/dunlin-package.md)
  :

  `Dunlin` Package

## Processing Functions

- [`co_relevels()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/co_relevels.md)
  : Reorder Two Columns Levels Simultaneously

- [`cut_by_group()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/cut_by_group.md)
  : Cutting data by group

- [`ls_explicit_na()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/ls_explicit_na.md)
  :

  Encode Categorical Missing Values in a `list` of `data.frame`

- [`ls_unite()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/ls_unite.md)
  :

  Unite Columns of a Table in a `list` of `data.frame`.

- [`join_adsub_adsl()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/join_adsub_adsl.md)
  :

  Join `adsub` to `adsl`

- [`multi_id_pivot_wider()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/multi_id_pivot_wider.md)
  : Transforming data.frame with Multiple Identifying columns into Wide
  Format

- [`poly_pivot_wider()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/poly_pivot_wider.md)
  : Transforming data.frame with multiple Data Column into Wide Format

- [`propagate()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/propagate.md)
  : Propagate Column

- [`reformat()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/reformat.md)
  : Reformat Values

- [`subject_level_flag()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/subject_level_flag.md)
  : Create Subject-level Flag from Long Data

## Helper functions

- [`get_arg()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/get_arg.md)
  : Getting Argument From System, Option or Default
- [`attr_label()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/attr_label.md)
  : Setting the Label Attribute
- [`attr_label_df()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/attr_label_df.md)
  : Setting the Label Attribute to Data Frame Columns

## Rule and Format

- [`rule()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/rule.md)
  : Create rule based on mappings

- [`as.list(`*`<rule>`*`)`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/as.list.rule.md)
  : Convert Rule to List

- [`list2rules()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/list2rules.md)
  :

  Convert nested list into list of `rule`

- [`combine_rules()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/combine_rules.md)
  : Combine Two Rules

- [`combine_list_rules()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/combine_list_rules.md)
  : Combine Rules Found in Lists of Rules.

## Filtering

- [`log_filter()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/log_filter.md)
  : Filter Data with Log
- [`get_log()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/get_log.md)
  : Get Log
- [`print_log()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/print_log.md)
  : Print Log

## Whiskers

- [`render_safe()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/render_safe.md)
  : Render whiskers safely
- [`add_whisker()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/add_whisker.md)
  : Add whisker values
- [`remove_whisker()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/remove_whisker.md)
  : Remove whisker values
- [`show_whisker()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/show_whisker.md)
  : Show Whisker Values

## Assertions

- [`assert_all_tablenames()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/assert_all_tablenames.md)
  :

  Assert that all names are among names of a `list` of `data.frame`.

- [`assert_valid_format()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/assert_valid_format.md)
  : Assert Nested List can be used as Format Argument in Reformat.

- [`assert_valid_list_format()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/reference/assert_valid_list_format.md)
  : Assert List can be Converted into a Nested List Compatible with the
  Format Argument of Reformat.

# Articles

### All vignettes

- [Reformatting](https://insightsengineering.github.io/dunlin/articles/Reformatting.md):
